intro: Allosorus ochraceus, commonly known as the yellow rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Allosorus ochraceus is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, dry environments.
